description: The app does not seem to be maintained any more.
summary: Does not work on Rocky Linux 8.6

description:
I have a lot of time trying to find a simple image editor to allow me to mark-up screenshots. I see application after application for full image editing, color control, fine artists, and 2D/3D rendering. All I wanted was to easily draw arrows, boxes, and circles, and add some text to the image.

HotShots does exactly this! That it comes with an easy screenshot interface is just sauce for the goose. Within just two or three minutes I had figured out the UI and began capturing, marking up, saving, and exporting my screenshot.

This is exactly what I've been looking for!
summary: Exactly what I've been searching for!

description: The fifth screenshot tool I test on Fedora 35 that is broken. This one opens, but when you click on any button to actually take the screenshot, it crashes ...
summary: Does not work, simply crashes when trying to take a screenshot

description: Crashed the first time I tried to take a screenshot on Fedora 35 Silverblue.
app look like good, but crashed each time when i want make a screen. so it's a small problem in screenshot app
